Message.Title: Fed can start tapering with confidence: S&P just upgrade US Debt????
Message.Msg: U.S. stock index futures were in positive territory Monday, with major averages looking to extend last week's rally following the government jobs report, lifted by positive economic news from Japan and after S&P revised its rating on U.S. sovereign credit outlook. The ratings agency raised its sovereign credit outlook to "stable" from "negative," with a current rating of AA+, adding that the likelihood of a near-term downgrade is "less than one in three." "Under our criteria, the credit strengths of the U.S. include its resilient economy, its monetary credibility, and the U.S. dollar's status as the world's key reserve currency," according to the S&P. "Similarly, in our view, the U.S.'s credit weaknesses, compared with higher rated sovereigns, include its fiscal performance, its debt burden, and the effectiveness of its fiscal policymaking."

Topic.Title: Fed can start tapering with confidence: S&P just upgrade US Debt????

Message.Msg: I get a chuckle out of all those who panic at the thought of the Feds slowing down their current stimulus. Not too ago that would have been seen as a positive since it means the Feds think the economy is strong enough to allow such a move. People have become addicted to the exceptionally low rates we've had the last few years, completely forgetting that those low rates are a symptom of the financial crisis. Historically, normal rates are higher, with the norm for mortgages being in the 6% range. We need to move in that direction, slowly of course.
